subject: Creativity
title: The Next Creative Revolution: What Comes After the Internet
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Next Creative Revolution: What Comes After the Internet.

hook.text: The printing press created publishing. Photography created visual culture. The internet created the creator economy.

buildup.text: AR/VR (spatial computing) merges digital creativity with physical space. Designers will sculpt in 3D air.

discovery.text: Apple's Vision Pro, Meta's Quest, and emerging startups are building the platforms.

twist.text: Every new medium initially copies the old one (early TV was filmed radio, early web was digital brochures).

climax.text: Whoever invents spatial computing's 'native creative form' â€” like film invented cinema or social media invented memes.

punchline.text: The next creative revolution is already being built.

quiz.question: Why do new creative mediums initially mimic old ones?
options: Creators default to familiar forms before discovering the new medium's native creative language
